text: Scott Brown (born September 12, 1959) is an American attorney and politician. He was the United States Ambassador to New Zealand from June 8, 2017 until December 20, 2020. He was a United States Senator from the state of Massachusetts from 2010 to 2013. He is a member of the U.S. Republican Party. ==Early life== Brown was born on September 12, 1959 in Kittery, Maine. He studied at Tufts University and at Boston College. ==Ambassadorship== On February 17, 2017, news media outlets reported that Brown was under consideration by President Donald Trump to be the U.S. ambassador to New Zealand. On April 20, 2017, it was reported that he was chosen to be the next Ambassador to New Zealand. On June 8, 2017, the United States Senate confirmed his nomination to a 94-4 vote. He resigned on December 20, 2020. ==References== ==Other websites== * * 2010 Campaign Website, archived October 16, 2014 Category:1959 births Category:Living people Category:Lawyers from Maine Category:American colonels Category:American models Category:Politicians from Maine Category:United States senators from Massachusetts Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Ambassadors of the United States to New Zealand Category:Ambassadors of the United States to Samoa Category:Military people from Maine
title: Scott Brown
